title: Nissan's new Juke, Wrong colours for your car - Top motoring stories of the day
text:
Cars are pricey, but you could get good value for your money when selling your family sedan - take a look at some of the options currently available on the market with the best resale value.

Brightly coloured cars, or even dark cars, might be eye-catching but it is not an entirely good choice for the long term, especially if you need to have it resprayed due to damage.

In case you missed it

Nissan's latest offering of the Juke has officially gone into production at its Sunderland plant in the United Kingdom.

SEE | Polo, Corolla, Ciaz: Here's which affordable sedan offers the best resale value

Wheels24's Charlen Raymond took part in an electric roadtrip across South Africa and discusses whether these types of cars are viable to consumer.

This weekend's Japanese Grand Prix still hangs in the balance as Typhoon Hagibis descends upon Suzuka on Saturday.
